critique: This executive order pertains to the transfer of land in Amaknak Island, Alaska, from the Department of Agriculture to the Secretary of the Navy, while still allowing the Department of Agriculture and Alaska natives to use the land when it doesn't interfere with naval activities. It modifies previous executive orders. There is a mention of protecting the fishing rights of Alaska natives, which suggests a slight tilt towards social inclusion. Given that it is an executive order, there is a slight expansion of executive power, but it is not significant. The order seems to balance different interests (Navy, Agriculture, Alaska natives).
